marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Projects Retail Sales Growth in November 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia projects that retail sales in November 2024 will grow +0.4% month-on-month and +1.7% year-on-year. Retail sales in November 2024 are expected to be supported by sales of information and communication equipment, other household equipment, and the apparel sub-category. In October 2024, retail sales grew +1.5% year-on-year, although it contracted –0.01% month-on-month (versus September 2024: +4.8% year-on-year, –2.5% month-on-month).

marketNews.title: Plt Dirjen Migas Signals Continuation of Gas Price Incentives in 2025
marketNews.content: Plt Dirjen Migas of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Dadan Kusdiana, signaled that the gas price incentive (HGBT) will continue in 2025. Dadan said the ministry has received a recommendation from the Ministry of Industry to add 15 new sub-sectors as recipients of HGBT next year, although he did not detail them further. He also emphasized that the HGBT price next year will not differ much from the current level of US$6 per MMBtu.

marketNews.title: KUFPEC Explores Natuna D-Alpha Gas Block
marketNews.content: Country Manager of Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company (KUFPEC) in Indonesia, Sara Al-Baker, said the company is conducting a study and exploring the Natuna D-Alpha gas block and plans to participate in future government gas block offerings. The Natuna D-Alpha block is estimated to contain 230 trillion cubic feet of gas, one of the world’s largest resources. KUFPEC already operates in the Natuna Sea with a stake in Natuna Block A, which supplies gas to Singapore, and Block Anambas, which is in the process of obtaining development approval.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Heavy-Equipment Tax to Rise to 12% in 2025
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Heavy Equipment Agents Association, Yushi Sandidarma, said the implementation of a heavy-equipment tax will become a burden for heavy-equipment customers, especially as the value-added tax (VAT) rises to 12% in 2025. He noted that heavy-equipment sales in 2025 could potentially decline again. The heavy-equipment tax is regulated by Law No. 1/2022 and targets products such as excavators, bulldozers, cranes, loaders, backhoes, motor graders, dump trucks, diesel hammers, and scrapers. Some regions have already imposed the tax, while North Kalimantan will implement it in 2025.

tickerNews.title: EXCL and FREN Announce Merger Details
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata (EXCL) and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) announced a definitive merger agreement with a pre-synergy enterprise value of more than IDR 104 trillion (approximately US$6.5 billion). EXCL will be the surviving entity under the new name PT XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera Tbk. The agreed merger exchange ratio is 1 FREN share for 0.011 shares of the combined company (i.e., about 91 FREN shares for 1 EXCL share). One pre-merger EXCL share will retain one share of the combined company but with a 27.95% ownership dilution. For the minority shareholder of PT Smart Telecom, PT Industri Telekomunikasi Indonesia, one minority share will receive 0.005 EXCL shares. Axiata and Sinarmas will each hold 34.8% of the combined EXCL, while the public will hold 30.4%. Sinarmas’s share will be sourced from PT Bali Media Telekomunikasi (24.6%), PT Global Nusa Data (4.7%), PT Wahana Inti Nusantara (2.9%) and PT Gerbangmas Tunggal Sejahtera (2.6%). To equalise ownership, Sinarmas, via PT Bali Media Telekomunikasi, will purchase roughly 2.4 billion EXCL shares from Axiata for a maximum cash consideration of US$475 million (≈IDR 7.5 trillion), implying a price of IDR 3,157 per share. The payment includes US$400 million (≈IDR 6.3 trillion, IDR 2,659 per share) at the initial transaction and an additional US$75 million (≈IDR 1.2 trillion) if the “Deferred Consideration” condition is met. A buy-back option is offered to any EXCL or FREN minority shareholders who do not agree with the merger, up to 10% of the pre-merger shares with a total allocation of up to IDR 3.09 trillion. The buy-back price is IDR 2,350 per EXCL share and IDR 25 per FREN share. If the required buy-back exceeds IDR 3.09 trillion, Axiata and Sinarmas will act as joint standby purchasers in equal portions. For FREN warrant series III (FREN-W2), FREN grants all FREN-W2 warrant holders the right to exercise their warrants within at least three months from 11 December 2024. Management said the merger could generate pre-tax synergies of US$300-400 million, equal to 21-30% of the pro-forma combined EBITDA for 3Q24 TTM. Synergies are expected mainly from (1) optimisation of overlapping network sites (14,000-20,000 sites, 20-30% of total sites) and (2) optimisation of sales channels, both marketing activation and digital channels. The combined blended ARPU is expected to fall slightly from IDR 41,000 due to FREN’s lower blended ARPU, and EBITDA margin will decline from 51.5% to 49.4%. Guidance on the combined performance will be provided later. The merger is targeted to close in 1H 2025, with the extraordinary general meeting scheduled for 21 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Announces Higher-Grade Gold Reserves
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals, through its subsidiary PT Citra Palu Minerals (CPM), announced higher-grade gold reserves at the River Reef and Hill Reel mines in Poboya, Palu. The average gold grade of the two sites is 3.2 g/t (versus CPM’s FY23 grade of 2.4 g/t), with total gold content of 3.54 million ounces (versus 2.4 million ounces in FY23). About 85% of the gold content comes from underground mining at River Reef, which has a grade of 4.9 g/t. BRMS also reported 8.6 million ounces of silver at 7.8 g/t. CPM announced that PT Macmahon Indonesia, a subsidiary of Macquarie-owned Macquarie Holdings Limited, will be the contractor for the Poboya gold project. Underground development at River Reef is targeted to start in 2Q 2025, with underground pit production expected to begin at the end of 2027.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Reports November 2024 Marketing Sales
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung reported marketing sales of IDR 337.46 billion (-35% month-on-month, -5% year-on-year) in November 2024. The result brings 11-month-2024 marketing sales to approximately IDR 3.51 trillion (-5% year-on-year), reaching only 70% of the 2024 target of IDR 5 trillion. The residential segment contributed 75% of 11M24 marketing sales, followed by retail (13%), apartments (6%), land parcels (4%) and office/commercial (2%).

tickerNews.title: DOID Director Discusses Dawson Complex Acquisition and Funding
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur’s director Iwan Fuad Salim said the acquisition of the Dawson Complex metallurgical coal mine will contribute US$130-200 million of EBITDA per year. He said the Dawson Complex transaction will be completed no later than 2Q 2025, so the mine’s contribution to the company’s EBITDA in 2025 is expected to be US$65-100 million. He also said a new equity injection of US$62.1 million (Australia) by the DOID entity in the copper mining business 29Metals Ltd. (ASX: 29M) will be completed by the end of December 2024. Iwan added that DOID’s Q3 2024 financial results will be released at the end of December 2024.

tickerNews.title: SSIA Targets 2025 Revenue and Profit
tickerNews.content: The Vice President of Investor Relations & Corporate Communications of Surya Semesta Internusa, Erlin Budiman, said the company targets revenue of IDR 6 trillion in 2025 (versus a 2024 target of IDR 6.3 trillion) and net profit of IDR 400 billion (versus a 2024 target of IDR 300 billion). The conservative target reflects that the Hotel Melia Bali segment is under renovation and will be closed until 2026. Erlin said the company remains optimistic about meeting the 2024 revenue target because BYD will complete the purchase of 108 hectares of industrial land in Subang Smartpolitan in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Signs EPC Contract for B1 and MTBE Capacity Expansion
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific announced that it has signed an engineering, procurement and construction contract with PT Inti Karya Persada Tehnik to expand the butene-1 (B1) plant and the methyl-tert-butyl ether (MTBE) plant located within TPIA’s integrated petrochemical complex in Ciwandan, Banten. The expansion will raise B1 and MTBE capacities by more than 25%. B1 is a key feedstock for polyethylene resin production, while MTBE is an octane-boosting additive for gasoline.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Studies Reactivation of Oil & Gas Fields
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada announced that it is conducting a study to reactivate oil and gas fields and to assess undeveloped discoveries in its concession areas. The study will consider 3-D seismic acquisition, appraisal drilling, development wells, installation of very-low-pressure (VLP) compressors, and acquisition of well-bore data and work-over operations, with an estimated investment of US$100 million.

tickerNews.title: JSMR and Hutama Karya Will Not Discount Toll Rates for Holiday Season
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga’s President Director Subakti Syukur said JSMR and PT Hutama Karya will not give toll-rate discounts during the Christmas and New Year period, because traffic volume during that period is lower than during Ramadan. The decision was taken because the two state-owned enterprises will operate seven toll roads covering 120 km during the holiday period. Although no discount will be offered for the holiday period, Subakti said the company may consider a toll-rate discount for Ramadan 2025.

tickerNews.title: WOOD Partners with Ciputra Development for Housing Project
tickerNews.content: Integra Indocabinet (WOOD) announced a cooperation with Ciputra Development (CTRA) and PT Ciputra Cipta Cemerlang to develop a residential housing area on the WOOD-owned land in Sidoarjo, East Java. The cooperation targets the middle-class market with “relatively affordable” pricing. The company said the partnership could increase the company’s revenue and net profit, although no further details were provided.

tickerNews.title: IPCM Announces Interim Dividend for 2024
tickerNews.content: Jasa Armada Indonesia (IPCM) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of approximately IDR 20 billion (IDR 3.8 per share). The cum-date is the regular market and the record date is 19 December 2024, with payment on 10 January 2025. Based on the closing price of IPCM on Wednesday (11 December) at IDR 274 per share, the implied dividend yield is about 1.4%.

tickerNews.title: HUMI Purchases Tanker for Expansion
tickerNews.content: Humpuss Maritim Internasional (HUMI) through its subsidiary PT Hutama Trans Kencana announced the purchase of one tanker unit for approximately US$3 million (IDR 47.2 billion) from affiliate PT Humpuss Transportasi Kimia. The transaction is intended for business expansion and diversification of the portfolio. PT Humpuss Transportasi Kimia is controlled by HUMI’s parent company Humpuss Intermoda Transportasi (HITS).
